event.name: PAVONIAN_DO_NOT_CARE
event.text: The Pavonian ship at the beacon just stays at the same spot without paying you any attention.
You send a brief greeting message to Pavonian ship but there is no answer.

choice.text: Ask if they support the Rebels or Federation.

event.text: You ask about Pavonian allegiance but there is no answer. It seems that they're either neutral or wait for you to uncover your allegiance first.

choice.text: Tell about your mission without going into details.

event.text: You explained to Pavonian ship how you intend to defeat the Rebellion with one swift strike. The Pavonians pay you no notice.

choice.text: Tell the Pavonians about incoming Rebel fleet.

event.text: You explain at length about the Rebel threat and how the Rebels are capturing whole sectors just looking for your ship. The Pavonian ship doesn't seem to care.

choice.text: Ask if there is anyone alive on the ship.

event.text: The Pavonian ship finally responds: "Yes. Now could you kindly go away?" The ship arms the weapons. Looks like they won't take no for an answer.

textList.text: You stumble upon an automated drone factory. Its structure resembles Pavonian designs. Scans show it is unarmed and completely defenseless not counting the drones swarming inside.

choice.text: Take one of the drones to your ship. You may find some use for it.

event.text: You board the station and steal one of the drones. There are no security systems, so you think about just leaving the factory.

You take some spare drone parts and make your leave. The station continues working while you undock as if nothing happened. You could loot the whole factory, but you can't risk the Rebel fleet finding you.
You take some spare drone parts and make your leave. But while you were occupied, a Pavonian ship has jumped into the system and is rapidly moving towards your ship with hostile intentions.

As you grab spare drone parts, the alarms go off. An explosion shakes your ship, still docked to the station. The pirate ship, the true owner of the drone factory, has jumped into the system and moves towards your ship with weapons online.

event.name: PAVONIAN_TWO_MANTIS
event.text: You arrive at the beacon and witness an ongoing battle between two Mantis ships. A lonely Pavonian ship is drifting through space, just far enough from the fight not to catch a stray shot.

choice.text: Attack one of the Mantis ships.

event.text: Just as you decided to make a move against one of the Mantis ships, its opponent exploded. The remaining Mantis ship moves into combat position, locking weapons on your ship.

destroyed.text: With both Mantis ships destroyed, you harvest useful scrap material from the remains. You contact the Pavonians expecting a reward for helping them.

event.text: The Pavonians pay you no notice. They didn't even consider themselves in danger.

deadCrew.text: With one of the Mantis ships destroyed, and another disabled, you loot the ships. You contact the Pavonians expecting a reward for helping them.

event.text: The Pavonians pay you no notice. They didn't even consider themselves in danger.

choice.text: Warn the Pavonians about possible danger.

event.text: You explain that after destroying its opponent, the winning Mantis ship might go after the Pavonians. "Oh..." The Pavonian ship jumps away.

choice.text: Attack one of the Mantis ships.

event.text: Just as you decided to make a move against one of the Mantis ships, its opponent exploded. The remaining Mantis ship moves into combat position, locking weapons on your ship.

choice.text: Ignore the battle and jump away.
Ignore the battle and jump away.

event.name: PAVONIAN_LANIUS
event.text: A Lanius ship, rare guest outside of few sectors, is absorbing the wreck of some ship that's too late to identify. The Pavonian vessels are moving in the distance, without paying attention to either you or the Lanius.

choice.text: Attack the Lanius, someone has to stop them.

event.text: Acknowledging you as a threat, the Lanius ship stops collecting scrap metal and locks its weapons on your ship.

event.name: PAVONIAN_WASTE
event.text: A lonely Pavonian ship awaits you at the beacon. It completely ignores you, drifting through space. Suddenly, its airlocks open, and a huge pile of waste is ejected. It is flying right at your ship!
Your pilot tried their best, but the pile of waste still manages to hit your ship. No serious damage was done to the hull, but the Pavonians must still pay for that.
The pile of waste misses your cruiser. But just dumping your waste into space is gross and unacceptable.

choice.text: Collect the waste, there could be something useful there.

event.text: To your surprise, you managed to find a functioning weapon and some scrap in the pile of junk.
To your disappointment, all of the waste turned out to be biological. No scrap metal was found.

choice.text: (Flak Gun) Load the waste as ammunition and launch it into Pavonian ship.

event.text: The Pavonians were not expecting THAT. A chunk of their ship's hull has fallen off, and they turn towards you, arming their weapons.

event.name: PAVONIAN_WASTE_CONFRONT
event.text: There are no words "illegal", "outlawed" or "consequence" in Pavonian language, and they struggle to understand that they did something wrong. They don't even apologize and completely ignore your demands to pay for the damage their waste has done to your ship and, most importantly, your feelings.

choice.text: Let the Pavonians go this time.

event.name: PAVONIAN_BEGGAR
event.text: The only ship at the beacon is controlled by Pavonians. Their negotiator appears on the comm: "Scrap. We need it. Please give us some scrap."
The Pavonians look pleased. "Thank you so much, mystery benefactor. We don't have anything to pay you with, but please follow us. You won't be disappointed." The Pavonian ship jumps away.
